sentences.sContent: Perhaps she’d never really been there at all – perhaps she’d just imagined it.
sentences.sCn: 可能她从未到过那儿——也许这都是她的幻想。

sentences.sContent: ...Fantasy proneness could be considered a tendency to imagine and daydream...
...I could imagine what the teacher was saying or what it looked like in the book...
...Just imagine a world where everyone keep talking but nobody listening...
...Try to imagine what it is like to live without electricity...
...We envy famous men and imagine that fame was due to some trick of luck...

words.tran: 虚构的，假想的；想像的；虚数的
虚构的；富于想像的；有创造力的
[心理] 想象力；空想；幻想物

trans.tranOther: to form a picture or idea in your mind about what something could be like
